title: Famous Explorers Recall
description: How many of history's greatest explorers can you remember?

questions.question: Who led the first expedition to successfully circumnavigate the globe?
questions.explanation: Ferdinand Magellan led the first expedition to circumnavigate the globe starting in 1519. Though he died in the Philippines, his crew completed the journey in 1522.

questions.question: Which explorer is credited with 'discovering' the Americas in 1492?
questions.explanation: Christopher Columbus sailed from Spain and reached the Bahamas on October 12, 1492, opening the Americas to European exploration.

questions.question: Which Portuguese explorer was the first European to reach India by sea?
questions.explanation: Vasco da Gama reached Calicut, India in 1498, establishing a sea route from Europe to Asia around the Cape of Good Hope.

questions.question: Who led the Lewis and Clark Expedition across North America?
questions.explanation: Meriwether Lewis and William Clark led the Corps of Discovery expedition (1804-1806) to explore the western territories of the United States.

questions.question: Which explorer first reached the South Pole in December 1911?
questions.explanation: Norwegian explorer Roald Amundsen and his team reached the South Pole on December 14, 1911, beating Robert Scott's British expedition by about five weeks.

questions.question: Which Viking explorer is believed to have reached North America around 1000 AD?
questions.explanation: Leif Erikson is believed to have reached North America (Vinland) around 1000 AD, nearly 500 years before Columbus.

questions.question: Which Spanish conquistador conquered the Aztec Empire?
questions.explanation: Hernán Cortés conquered the Aztec Empire between 1519 and 1521, capturing the capital Tenochtitlan and overthrowing Emperor Montezuma.

questions.question: Which explorer mapped much of the African interior and was found by journalist Henry Morton Stanley?
questions.explanation: Scottish explorer David Livingstone explored Africa's interior for decades. Stanley found him in 1871 with the famous greeting, 'Dr. Livingstone, I presume?'

questions.question: Which Spanish conquistador conquered the Inca Empire in Peru?
questions.explanation: Francisco Pizarro conquered the Inca Empire in 1532-1533, capturing Emperor Atahualpa and claiming Peru for Spain.

questions.question: Which English explorer claimed the east coast of Australia for Britain in 1770?
questions.explanation: Captain James Cook charted the east coast of Australia during his first voyage and claimed it for Great Britain, naming it New South Wales.

questions.question: Which explorer is the Americas named after?
questions.explanation: The Americas were named after Italian explorer Amerigo Vespucci, who recognized that the lands Columbus found were a separate continent, not Asia.

questions.question: Which explorer led a famous Antarctic expedition on the ship Endurance?
questions.explanation: Ernest Shackleton's Endurance became trapped in Antarctic pack ice in 1915, leading to one of the greatest survival stories in exploration history.

questions.question: Which Portuguese prince sponsored many voyages of exploration down the African coast?
questions.explanation: Prince Henry the Navigator (1394-1460) sponsored numerous exploratory voyages along the African coast, ushering in the Age of Exploration.

questions.question: Who was the first European to reach the Pacific Ocean from the Americas?
questions.explanation: Vasco Núñez de Balboa crossed the Isthmus of Panama and became the first European to see the Pacific Ocean from the Americas in 1513.

questions.question: Which explorer sailed for England and explored the northeastern coast of North America in 1497?
questions.explanation: John Cabot (Giovanni Caboto), an Italian sailing for England, reached the coast of North America in 1497, giving England a claim to the New World.
